activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Philip D Hodges Jr.

records.addlTxt: Request for zoom appearance from the Defendant.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

Defendant Philip D Hodges Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alex Kitto appeared by video for Philip D Hodges Jr. for today only. Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. WARRANT QUASHED.
Qualifies for public defender. AIA set before Judge Boyle and court finds good cause for the adjournment.  Must appear in person. State requests cash bond.  1:28 p.m. Attorney Kitto and Defendant put in a breakout room. 1:30 p.m. Back on the record.  Bond set.  Address confirmed and phone number provided/updated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Philip D Hodges Jr. not in court.
State requests warrant.  PCW - Body Only - Nationwide
